title: Drawing, "Study for a Painted Wall Decoration:  Two Putti beside a Vase with Flowers", ca. 1720
medium: Pen and wash with brown ink and black chalk, on off-white paper, lined
signed: Signed and dated in lower right corner.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The rose stands upon a pedestal behind the top of a triangular moulding. The left putto kneels, the right one sits. They carry a rope which swings from the vase.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Study for a Painted Wall Decoration:  Two Putti beside a Vase with Flowers", ca. 1720.
ca. 1720. Pen and wash with brown ink and black chalk, on off-white paper, lined. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7075.
